oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pardon & Amnesty of George Pattison
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Certificate of pardon and amnesty of George Pattison, Shelby County, Tenn., "for all offences by him committed, arising from participation, direct or implied, in the [Rebellion], under conditions issued by President Andrew Johnson and co-signed by Secretary of State William H. Seward.

Under the conditions of the Presidential Proclamation of May 29, 1865, the amnesty provision pardoned all participants in the Southern Rebellion, restored their properties (except for slaves and any property that had been or might be legally confiscated), and required them to take the loyalty oath to the United States Constitution. Mr. Pattison would have received this pardon after taking the loyalty oath.
